name: Liberty Hill Inn

reviews.text: We did not find Liberty Hill on trip advisor however, as it was such a great place to stay I decided it was only fair to the rest of our fellow travellers to write a review.
reviews.title: Comfy bed!

reviews.text: The house is very well presented, very clean, the beds wonderfully comfortable, the breakfast truly excellent and they even provided me with BOILING water for my "brought from home English tea bags".
reviews.title: We Love the Liberty Hill Inn!
Very friendly and comfortable
reviews.text: The restaurant recommendations were very good as well. We thoroughly enjoyed our two day stay and when we do our leaf peeping tour in 3-4 years you can bet we will be staying there again.

reviews.title: Best of the lot
reviews.text: Thank you, John and Kris, for another amazing stay at your inn. It was fun spending the new year's weekend at the inn and with you both. You made us feel at home for our first visit on Thanksgiving 2004, and each stay gets better. Kris, your cooking talents are superb and breakfast is so delicious. John, you are the best story teller! The rooms at the inn are beautiful and immaculately clean. Our favorite, Hallet, has the most comfortable bed anywhere. We miss you both, and Bailey and Conrad already! See you in February:)

reviews.title: Like being at home, but better!
reviews.text: We were made very welcome, the rooms very comfortable, lots of helpfull advice about sight seeing. Handy for several good nearby restaurants. Thanks to John and Kris for a enjoyable stay.

reviews.title: Best part of my trip!
reviews.text: I decided to go to the Cape of MA in Oct thinking the weather would be perfect with leaves changing color and the air fresh. I chose the Liberty Hill Inn because it seemed centrally convenient to the whole Cape. At least I was right on one count. The Inn was conveniently located for the entire Cape. While the weather was not what I was hoping for, the Inn was great! The room was far better than the pictures showed. The Innkeepers were very gracious and accomodating with requests. Breakfasts (the mornings I got out of the featherbed) were delicious and well-balanced. Even when I chose not to eat breakfast in the Main House, there was always fresh fruit and water by the bedside. I was close enough to everything but still away from all the hectic traffic on the southern side of the Cape. I will definitely recommend Liberty Hill Inn to friends and family. I'll also plan on staying there when I go back to visit Martha's Vineyard.

reviews.title: Loved Liberty Hill Inn
reviews.text: We were looking forward to a nice. relaxing 3 days away from the grind, at a place that was clean, quaint, quiet, had good food, and was close to everything. Liberty Hill Inn was that and more! We saw so much of the Cape in those three days, yet never felt rushed or tired. The rooms were remarkable, and included warm, rich furniture, a great fireplace, and a clean and roomy bath. The main house, where breakfast and snacks were served, was equally incredible. Kris knocked our socks off with great breakfasts that kept us satisfied for most of the day. And John and Kris both made fantastic restaurant recommendations at places within 5 minutes from the Inn. If I ever travel back to the Cape, I will definitely stay at Liberty Hill Inn again. Thanks, John and Kris!!!

In agreement with my fellow travellers, my fiancee and I stayed here in August, and had a wonderful time. From the moment you walk into the inviting, comfortable parlor, you can tell this is a place of welcome. We were in the Eldridge room in the Carriage House, which while newer, was well-decorated with antiques and a comfortable canopied bed. Plus it had a nice double whirlpool bath. Little touches such as a refrigerator right outside the room added to our enjoyment. But one of the best parts of the stay was the hospitality of John & Kris. Always ready to please you, they make you feel welcome with a smile. They are interesting conversationalists and consummate hosts. Friendly bassett hounds add a homey touch. Great breakfasts and friendly talk with other guests make this an overall great inn experience.
reviews.title: A Great Overall Inn Experience
We can't wait to return!
reviews.text: Yarmouthport is in central Cape Cod. It is on the quiet side of 6A, but near great restaurants, beaches, views and relaxation.

reviews.title: Felt like home
reviews.text: Although "a cut above" and "going above and beyond the call of duty" are overworked cliches, they are the absolute truth when applied to the Liberty Hill Inn. This is a world class b&b. Our room was graciously appointed and very charming, bright,and airy. The hosts, John and Kris are all about making you feel at home and they do it so very well. It just comes so naturally to them that you feel like you are visiting with your very best friends. They honestly want you to feel at home and comfortable there and will do whatever you need to have your stay be a happy one. they'll reccommend restaurants and give you tips on how to get places or where to go; they will even drirve you if you need that. My husband and I were so very comfortable and happy there, that we look forward to returning and won't consider staying anywhere else. If need be I would change the dates of our stay rather than have to stay anywhere else on our next year's trip to Yarmouthport.

description: Built by shipwrights in 1825, set back from the historic Old Kings Highway on a little knoll with lilacs, roses and centuries old rhododendron. This majestic inn reflects the charm and elegance of a bygone era. Yarmouth Port, is the "heart" of Cape Cod. Our central location provides easy and convenient access to all Cape Cod's attractions. You are invited to relax and enjoy nine spacious guest rooms - it's the ultimate Cape Cod experience.
